required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The HairDx Test reports genetic variants associated with the development of FPHL.

detailed_description.textblock: The HairDx Test reports genetic variants associated with the development of FPHL. The variants are detected from a saliva sample collected at home. The HairDx Test report is designed to help individuals understand the meaning of their results and encourage a conversation with a healthcare professional. The information provided by the HairDx Test report is not intended to start, stop or change any course of treatment. The purpose of this study is to collect DNA samples from subjects. The DNA samples will be used for the analytical validation of the HairDx Test. The results of this study will not be shared with the subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Determination of the accuracy of the HairDx Test
primary_outcome.description: Determination of the accuracy of the HairDx Test in comparison to bi-directional Sanger sequencing

primary_outcome.measure: Determination of the precision and reproducibility of HairDx Test
primary_outcome.description: Determination of the precision and reproducibility of HairDx Test in accordance with the laboratory instructions for use documentation

arm_group.description: Female subjects providing DNA saliva sample

intervention.description: Saliva collection using FDA OTC cleared sample collection device

study_pop.textblock: Female subjects recruited from an online advertisement approved by the IRB

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Females over the age of 18
- Overall good health
- Able to give informed consent
- Willing to collect saliva sample
Exclusion Criteria:
- Xerostomia (dry mouth)
- Inability to provide informed consent in English
- Inability to follow instructions for saliva sample collection
- Non US resident

reference.citation: Redler S, Birch P, Drichel D, Hofmann P, Dobson K, Böhmer AC, Becker J, Giehl KA, Tazi-Ahnini R, Kruse R, Wolff H, Miesel A, Fischer T, Böhm M, Nuwayhid R, Garcia Bartels N, Lutz G, Becker T, Blume-Peytavi U, Nöthen MM, Messenger AG, Betz RC. The oestrogen receptor 2 (ESR2) gene in female-pattern hair loss: replication of association with rs10137185 in German patients. Br J Dermatol. 2014 Apr;170(4):982-5. doi: 10.1111/bjd.12756.

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will only be shared with FDA.
